tweets.html:
I said I wouldn't believe #ArrestedDevelopment was actually returning until its first today of production. Today is that day. I believe!

— Cassie Belek (@cassiebelek) August 7, 2012

same as it ever was pic.twitter.com/Npgvqsgw

— Emily Kapnek (@EmilyKapnek) August 7, 2012

@JustinFowler Assert otherwise in adamant comment threads.

— Jason Mittell (@jmittell) August 7, 2012

It's easy to belittle the attention given VP picks, but the choice could determine the casting for dozens of future reality shows.

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) August 7, 2012

Obama referred to Romney as "Romney Hood." Romney fired back that this was a bunch of "Obamaloney." As a comedian, I beg you both to STOP!

— Hari Kondabolu (@harikondabolu) August 7, 2012

Holy shit, Romney actually said 'Obamaloney'? Is he running to be our new President or Mr. Furley?

— Gerry Duggan (@GerryDuggan) August 8, 2012

Obama and Romney have reached the "Making fun of last names" stage of discourse already. Literal poo-flinging by October.

— Daniel Fienberg (@d_fienberg) August 8, 2012

tweets.author_name: Eric Goldman Likes the Star Wars
tweets.html:
Joss Whedon creating the Marvel TV series is... come on, it's the greatest thing ever.

— Eric Goldman Likes the Star Wars (@TheEricGoldman) August 7, 2012

tweets.author_name: Amy celebrates Wrinkle in Time instead of XMas
tweets.html:
Hey, so, um. If you need me. I'll just be over there. Hyperventilating. #Avengers #DAMMITJOSS

— Amy celebrates Wrinkle in Time instead of XMas (@spooloflies) August 7, 2012

Whoever's responsible for preventing Joss Whedon from dying of exhaustion, double down your efforts. You don't want to face angry fanpeople.

— Alexa Planje (@HerQueue) August 7, 2012

I want Whedon's Marvel TV series to be about a guy complaining to all his friends about superheroes. "They're so over," he'll say each week.

— Marvel's Infinity Waco (@johnwarrender) August 8, 2012

Daniel Day-Lewis was reportedly in character during the entire LINCOLN shoot, mostly screaming "WHAT THE HELL IS THAT?" at the camera.

— Matt Singer (@mattsinger) August 7, 2012

I think of the three nearly empty bottles of Newman's Own Lite Italian dressing in my pantry as a celebrity cloning project gone awry.

— Nathan Rabin (@nathanrabin) August 8, 2012

I think Revolution is going to be my Smash until Smash gets back. #Smash

— Mike McComb (@Rube_Goldberg) August 8, 2012

why why why do people call during MY SHOWS?!!

— Damian Holbrook (@damianholbrook) August 8, 2012

Listen, you guys, #OhSit is either going to be a masterpiece or...yeah, I can't even finish that tweet with a straight face. #OhShit

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) August 8, 2012

Nick is Googling "brothels." I am Googling "how to kill a television character yes I know they're not real." #TheLAComplex

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) August 8, 2012

@TVandDinners ...with a dinosaur?

— Andy (@AndyDaglas) August 8, 2012

If you can't tell the difference between delivery and DiGiorno, then you shouldn't be allowed to vote.

— Guy Endore-Kaiser (@GuyEndoreKaiser) August 8, 2012

I just saw the Bourne Legacy. Not to spoil anything, but there is a lot of running.

— Sean O'Neal (@seanoneal) August 8, 2012

I'm fat, but I'm not "perform a medley of 'Somewhere Over the Rainbow' and 'What a Wonderful World' on a ukelele" fat

— Eli Braden (@EliBraden) August 8, 2012

Four words, guys: "The Bachelor: Ryan Lochte." #dropsmic

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) August 7, 2012

Why don't they introduce some dogs into the discus event? Liven it up. #Olympics

— Dan Owen (@danowen79) August 7, 2012

If it wasn't for the Technical Knockout rule, Chumbawumba would be the greatest boxer of all time.

— Cole Stratton (@colestratton) August 7, 2012

She cheated on The Daily Show too??? @THR Robert Pattinson to Make First TV Appearance Since Kristen Stewart Cheated on 'Daily Show'

— Dave Itzkoff (@ditzkoff) August 8, 2012

@ditzkoff @THR Yeah, she watched an Odd Couple rerun instead.

— James Urbaniak (@JamesUrbaniak) August 8, 2012

If I had a water event in the Olympics, I'd walk into the pool all slow and dramatic just to see who'd watched Sunday's Breaking Bad.

— Brent Piaskoski (@BrentPiaskoski) August 7, 2012

The First of the Gang to Dive #MorrisseyOlympics

— Christopher Munroe (@munsimunsi) August 7, 2012

Boy, I hope they have some beach wedgieball tonight, I haven't seen any in about two hours. (Note: tv not on for two hours.)

— David J. Loehr (@dloehr) August 8, 2012

Watched an entire episode of television and beach volleyball is still. on. #Olympics

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) August 8, 2012

The only thing I like about these beach volleyball matches is how they play Muse's "Feeling Good" at the end. #Olympics #goodcover

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) August 8, 2012

"The last night of gymnastics..." promises the Comcast summary of tonight's #Olympics coverage. I DON'T BELIEVE YOU.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) August 8, 2012

Ryan Lochte is my favorite Andy Samberg character.

— James Urbaniak (@JamesUrbaniak) August 8, 2012

ABC counter-programming WIPEOUT against Olympic hurdles, which is kind of brilliant actually.

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) August 8, 2012

Let's all watch Jordyn Wieber cry some more!

— (((Andrew Rabin)))ðŸ“Ž (@arrabin56) August 8, 2012

Walsh Jennings' head shot on NBC makes her look like she's a sensitive poet.

— Kathleen (@KathleenND) August 8, 2012

Really, NBC? "She works the entire length of the beam"?

— The Rude Pundit (@rudepundit) August 8, 2012

As a proponent of close textual analysis, I appreciate this breakdown of American rower Henrik Rummelâ€™s, um, business. http://t.co/QnoAr4pK

— Chris Becker (@crsbecker) August 8, 2012

@crsbecker He's a rower? The headless shot of his junk had me CONVINCED he was in Women's Beach Volleyball...

— Adam Barken (@adambarken) August 8, 2012

The Karolyis are to do with the inquiry! That explains everything! Bela up there making writing motions. Love it! #Gymnastics

— FLAMES ON (@thesideofmyface) August 8, 2012

They done FUCKED UP Now! Bela's PISSED!

— Samuel L. Jackson (@SamuelLJackson) August 8, 2012

Yes! Paperwork! Very exciting! #Olympics

— Noel Kirkpatrick (@noelrk) August 8, 2012

I am a multiple gold-medalist in this event. RT @noelrk: Yes! Paperwork! Very exciting! #Olympics

— Tony Bleach (@acbleach) August 8, 2012

I'm happy for Aly, but now I understand why other countries hate us. #gymnasticsdrama

— Jennifer Schaefer (@jlschaefer) August 8, 2012

Can't NBC edit in some Law & Order clips for these Olympic appeals to heighten the drama?

— Awful Announcing (@awfulannouncing) August 8, 2012

US Gymnast Aly Raisman got rewarded after complaining. Which may also prove that she is one of my children.

— Josh Hara (@yoyoha) August 8, 2012

Yo Bela Karolyic is NO JOKE. He was like u betta give that li'l girl her bronze! He's crazee as a loon but he knows his muhfukin gymnastics!

— Retta (@unfoRETTAble) August 8, 2012

If anybody can do it, it's us. RT @netw3rk: I wish the U.S. could produce an Olympic level track athlete who also looks out of shape

— Bryan Fischer (@BryanDFischer) August 8, 2012

I can't keep Hope Solo and Lolo Jones separate.

— FLAMES ON (@thesideofmyface) August 8, 2012

Dance element trouble?! She was dancing in there somewhere????!!

— Samuel L. Jackson (@SamuelLJackson) August 8, 2012

Good Lord, gymnastics coach, STOP KISSING THAT YOUNG GIRL!!!

— Jack Burditt (@jackburditt) August 8, 2012

Do Olympic gymnasts ever suffer traumatic eye injuries due to all the glitter?

— Matt Quirion (@mquirion) August 8, 2012

That thumbs up from Mustafina to Raisman was great. It will not prevent anyone from writing a piece about how they're mean girls but whatevs

— Rebecca Traister (@rtraister) August 8, 2012

This music sounds like it is straight from one of those porny Mickey Rourke movies. #Olympics

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) August 8, 2012

I love how Aly Raisman looks so sleepy in each and every promo shot she has ever taken

— Willa Paskin (@willapaskin) August 8, 2012

Has anyone made a "your body is a Zonderland" joke yet? Yes? OK, then. #Olympics

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) August 8, 2012

The best part about men's gymnastics is the self-conscious goal to avoid crying.

— Zhibin Dai (@realzhibindai) August 8, 2012

What is NBC going to do when they don't have Misty May-Treanor and Kerri Walsh Jennings anymore?

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) August 8, 2012

From how often NBC shows it, SOMEbody out there must LOVE THE SHIT out of beach volleyball. Who are these people?

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) August 8, 2012

Giving the high jump heights in feet and inches is some serious bullshit, yo.

— June Thomas (@junethomas) August 8, 2012

If a moment from a new show endlessly repeated on #Olympics can make you despise it unseen, then Matthew Perry's laugh in GO ON has done it.

— Jason Mittell (@jmittell) August 8, 2012

NBC has one hour and 45 minutes, so it should be JUST enough time to show ALL of their Jordyn Wieber archival footage.

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) August 8, 2012

@tvoti They may be able to sell some to Lifetime for the movie, "Jordyn: An American Tragedy in Britain." (With DVD commentary from Costas)

— happy holidays sayer (@skeezerbozzer) August 8, 2012

NBC probably wishes Allyson Felix had not mentioned watching an ABC show while waiting for her race. (But SCANDAL *is* pretty fun.)

— Kathryn VanArendonk (@kvanaren) August 8, 2012

Kudos to NBC for not editing Alyson Felix's "Scandal" reference out of her post-race interview. Or ADR-ing "Grimm."

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) August 8, 2012

ABC is stealth sponsoring several athletes at this Olympics. As you'll see when Aly Raisman mentions how much she loves The Neighbors.

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) August 8, 2012

I may or may not have derisively said "Fuck you, Canadia," at the television. #Olympics

— Libby Hill (@midwestspitfire) August 8, 2012

It must be hard to shoot somebody in England right now without accidentally starting a 400m dash somewhere.

— Dan Clyne (@danCLYNE) August 8, 2012

Even the Olympic gymnasts seem to be tired of Olympic gymnastics.

— Ross McKeen (@mightytoycannon) August 8, 2012

"And in conclusion, Jordyn Wieber, Jordyn Wieber, Jordyn Wieber," Costas says, only to weep when she doesn't appear, as promised.

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) August 8, 2012

Love Aly Raismanâ€™s Hava Nagila theme this #Olympics, though have a feeling Marvin Hamlisch cld have come up with something better.

— Steven Zeitchik (@ZeitchikWaPo) August 8, 2012
